#lujvo: Given definitions of lujvo like 'j1 cuddles / snuggles j2': the letters explain where the places come from. Sometimes, you see it written differently: x1=j1 cuddels / snuggles x2=j2, both lying of x3=v2, with x4=j3 (part of x1) at locus x5=j4 (part of x2). This syntax is often used when places become merged. E.g. gerzda = x1=z1 is a house for dog x2=g1=x2 of breed/species x3=g2. Chapter 12 of the CLL does explain this place syntax http://lojban.org/publications/cll/cll_v1.1_xhtml-chapter-chunks/chapter-lujvo.html
#smuvanbi: To answer this question it's necessary to provide a full usage example or context where you would use this word/construct.
#jufra: Just say an English sentence and we will translate it for you.
#purdi: .i le nu tu purdi mi melbi
#gardenpath: .i le nu tu purdi mi melbi
#selkunti: Whorf described a workplace in which full gasoline drums were stored in one room and empty ones in another; he said that because of flammable vapor the "empty" drums were more dangerous than those that were full, although workers handled them less carefully to the point that they smoked in the room with "empty" drums, but not in the room with full ones. Whorf argued that by habitually speaking of the vapor-filled drums as empty and by extension as inert, the workers were oblivious to the risk posed by smoking near the 'empty drums'.

Also use this channel to ask any questions.

#noiha:
ko'a broda poi'a brodo = lo nu ko'a broda cu fasnu gi'e brodo
ko'a broda noi'a brodo = lo nu ko'a broda cu fasnu .i lo go'i cu brodo
ko'a broda soi'a brodo = lo nu ko'a broda cu brodo
ko'a broda soi ke'a brodo = ko'a broda .i lo nu go'i cu brodo
#n-paradigm:
beu  B  Bekti  (object)  ‘-/in’  Patients, Parts, Properties
cau  C  Canli  (quantity)  ‘by/for’  Quantities, Amounts, Values
dio  D  Dirco  (direction)  ‘to/for’  Recipients, Beneficiaries, Destinations
foa  F  Folma  (full)  ‘in/of’  Wholes, Sets, Collectivities
jui  J  Junti  (young)  ‘than’  Lessers in greater/lesser than relations
kao  K  Kakto  (act)  ‘-/by’  Actors, Agents, Doers
neu  N  Nerbi  (necessary)  ‘under’  Conditions, Fields, Circumstances
pou  P  Proju  (produce)  ‘-’  Products, Outputs, Purposes
goa  G  Groda  (big)  ‘than’  Greaters in greater/lesser than relations
sau  S  Satci  (start)  ‘from’  Sources, Origins, Reasons, Causes
veu  V  Vetci  (event)  ‘by/via’  Events, States, Deeds, Means, Routes, Effects
#gadri: e'u do retsku fi lylygy. fe le se du'u la'o zoi.xorlo.zoi cu mo kau
